CM may be perihilar with evident lymphadenitis and is commonly basilar. The density can vary from ground glass to consolidation. Cavitation is a complication of primary CM.
13, 14 In this case, the computed tomography demonstrated a new infectious process superimposed on the chronic right upper lobe cavitary lesion, leading to cavitary expansion. The multiple ground-glass opacities, mostly peripherally located, were completely new developments for this patient.
